title: Episode 4-2 Highlights | ♨Tension Alert♨ Kim Soo-hyun × Kim Ji-won × Park Sung-hoon, Spicy Relationship Dynamics
synopsis: Hyun-woo's jealousy flares when Eun-sung comes to their home for a weekend meeting with Hye-in. He confronts her about letting Eun-sung touch her hair when she hates it from others. Meanwhile, Hye-in shows her fierce side handling an aggressive customer, and surprises everyone by visiting Hyun-woo's rural hometown to win over his father's friends.

contents.original: 안녕하세요. 안녕하세요. 웬일이세요? 주말에 아침부터?
contents.pronunciation: Annyeong-haseyo. Annyeong-haseyo. Weniri-seyo? Jumar-e achim-buteo?
contents.translation: Hello. Hello. What brings you here? On a weekend morning?

grammar.explanation: Polite expression meaning 'what brings you here'

contents.original: 아, 베르키나 조율 협상안 때문에.
contents.pronunciation: A, Bereukina joyul hyeopsang-an ttaemun-e.
contents.translation: Oh, because of the Verkina negotiation adjustments.

contents.original: 아, 그런 거면 나도 같이 할까? 어차피 세부 사안 조율을 하려면 법무 팀도 공유를 해야 되니까.
contents.pronunciation: A, geureon geo-myeon na-do gachi halkka? Eochapi sebu sa-an joyul-eul haryeomyeon beommu tim-do gongyu-reul haeya doenikka.
contents.translation: Oh, if that's the case, should I join? We'd need to share with the legal team anyway for detailed adjustments.
contents.culture: Hyun-woo trying to insert himself into Hye-in and Eun-sung's meeting.

contents.original: 그건 추후 문제고요. 지금은 딜 브레이크 될 만한 요소들을 없애기 위해서 대표들끼리 단판 짓는 중입니다.
contents.pronunciation: Geugeon chuhu munje-goyo. Jigeum-eun dil beureikeu doel manhan yoso-deul-eul eopsaegi wihae-seo daepyo-deul-kkiri danpan jinneun jung-imnida.
contents.translation: That's a later issue. Right now, the CEOs are settling things one-on-one to eliminate deal-breakers.

grammar.example: 딜 브레이크 될 만한 = that could be deal-breakers
단판 짓는 중 = settling things decisively

contents.culture: Eun-sung politely but firmly excludes Hyun-woo from the meeting.

contents.original: 혹시 불편해? 불편하면 다른 데로 가고. 나 묵고 있는 호텔로 갈래?
contents.pronunciation: Hoksi bulpyeon-hae? Bulpyeon-hamyeon dareun de-ro gago. Na mukgo inneun hotel-lo gallae?
contents.translation: Are you uncomfortable? If so, we can go somewhere else. Want to go to the hotel I'm staying at?

grammar.example: 묵고 있는 호텔 = the hotel I'm staying at

contents.culture: Eun-sung's suggestion to go to his hotel room is provocative—he's testing boundaries.

contents.original: 아니야, 여기서 해. 편하게, 여기서.
contents.pronunciation: Aniya, yeogi-seo hae. Pyeonhage, yeogi-seo.
contents.translation: No, do it here. Make yourselves comfortable, here.

contents.original: 감사합니다.
contents.pronunciation: Gamsahamnida.
contents.translation: Thank you.

contents.original: 제가 더 감사하죠. 제 와이프 일 도와주시는 건데.
contents.pronunciation: Jega deo gamsahajyo. Je waipeu il dowajusineun geonde.
contents.translation: I should be more thankful. You're helping my wife with work.
contents.culture: Hyun-woo emphasizing 'my wife' to mark his territory in front of Eun-sung.

contents.original: 커피 할래? 어, 좋아. 고마워.
contents.pronunciation: Keopi hallae? Eo, joa. Gomawo.
contents.translation: Want coffee? Yeah, sure. Thanks.

contents.original: 당신도 마신다고? 공복에 커피 안 먹잖아.
contents.pronunciation: Dangsin-do masindago? Gongbok-e keopi an meokjana.
contents.translation: You're drinking too? You don't drink coffee on an empty stomach.
contents.culture: Hye-in knowing Hyun-woo's habits shows her care despite her cold demeanor.

contents.original: 그렇긴 하지.
contents.pronunciation: Geureokgin haji.
contents.translation: That's true.

contents.original: 은성 넌 에스프레소지? 응.
contents.pronunciation: Eunseong neon eseupeuresoji? Eung.
contents.translation: Eun-sung, you take espresso, right? Yeah.
contents.culture: Hye-in knowing Eun-sung's coffee preference irritates Hyun-woo.

contents.original: 네, 네, 네, 네. 아니, 제 생각을 저렇게 하네요.
contents.pronunciation: Ne, ne, ne, ne. Ani, je saenggak-eul jeureoke haneyo.
contents.translation: Yes, yes, yes, yes. No, she's thinking about me like that.

grammar.example: 제 생각을 저렇게 하네요 = she thinks of me like that

contents.culture: Hyun-woo sarcastically noting how Hye-in 'cares' about him.

contents.original: 네? 공복에 커피 독약이라고, 속 버린다고. 저렇게 못 먹게 하는 거 보세요.
contents.pronunciation: Ne? Gongbok-e keopi dok-yak-irago, sok beorin-dago. Jeureoke mot meokge haneun geo boseyo.
contents.translation: What? Saying coffee on an empty stomach is poison, that it'll ruin my stomach. Look how she stops me from drinking it.

grammar.example: 속 버린다고 = saying it ruins the stomach

contents.original: 아니, 제가 무슨 애도 아니고 말이죠. 제 걱정뿐인 건지...
contents.pronunciation: Ani, jega museun ae-do anigo malijyo. Je geokjeong-ppun-in geonji...
contents.translation: I mean, I'm not a child. Is she only worried about me...

grammar.explanation: Expression meaning 'I'm not even a child'
grammar.example: 제가 무슨 애도 아니고 = I'm not a child

contents.original: 혜인이가 남편분한테는 정말 각별한가 봐요. 부럽네요.
contents.pronunciation: Hyein-iga nampyeon-bun-hante-neun jeongmal gakbyeolhan-ga bwayo. Bureopneyo.
contents.translation: Hye-in must be really special to her husband. I'm envious.

grammar.example: 각별한가 봐요 = she must be special

contents.culture: Eun-sung's comment is subtly provocative—implying he wishes he had that treatment.

contents.original: 뭐, 그런 편이긴 합니다. 저한테나 안 그러거든요.
contents.pronunciation: Mwo, geureon pyeon-igin hamnida. Jeohante-na an geureogеodeunyo.
contents.translation: Well, that's how it is. Just not to me though.

grammar.example: 그런 편이긴 합니다 = it tends to be that way

contents.original: 맨날 힘들다, 도와달라. 이거 해줄 사람 너밖에 없다. 옛날부터 그랬어요.
contents.pronunciation: Maennal himdeulda, dowadalla. Igeo haejul saram neo-bakke eopda. Yennar-buteo geuraesseoyo.
contents.translation: Always saying it's hard, help me. You're the only one who can do this. It's been like that since the old days.
contents.culture: Eun-sung emphasizing his long history with Hye-in to make Hyun-woo uncomfortable.

contents.original: 지 힘들면 아무 때나 전화해서 이거 해달라, 저거 해달라. 너 말고 내가 누가 있냐. 그럼 더 안 해줄 수도 없고요.
contents.pronunciation: Ji himdeul-myeon amu ttae-na jeonhwa-haeseo igeo haedalla, jeogeo haedalla. Neo malgo naega nuga innya. Geureom deo an haejul su-do eopgoyo.
contents.translation: When she's struggling, she calls anytime asking me to do this or that. 'Who else do I have but you?' Then I can't not help.

grammar.pattern: 안 ~(으)ㄹ 수도 없다 (an eul su-do eopda)
grammar.example: 안 해줄 수도 없고 = I can't not help

contents.original: 이번 일도 그래요. 이런 협상 길면 1년도 넘게 걸릴 수 있는 일이거든요. 근데 2주 안에 해내라, 넌 할 수 있다.
contents.pronunciation: Ibeon il-do geuraeyo. Ireon hyeopsang gilmyeon il-nyeon-do neomge geollil su inneun il-igеodeunyo. Geunde i-ju an-e haenaera, neon hal su itda.
contents.translation: This deal is the same. A negotiation like this could take over a year. But she said do it in 2 weeks, you can do it.

grammar.example: 2주 안에 해내라 = accomplish it in 2 weeks

contents.original: 저 한국에 있는 동안 아무것도 못하게 생겼잖아요. 정말 혜인이 옆에 딱 붙어 있어야 될 것 같아요.
contents.pronunciation: Jeo Hanguk-e inneun dong-an amugeotdo mothage saenggyeotjanayo. Jeongmal Hyein-i yeop-e ttak buteo isseoya doel geot gatayo.
contents.translation: Looks like I won't be able to do anything else while I'm in Korea. I really need to stick right by Hye-in's side.

grammar.example: 딱 붙어 있어야 될 것 같아요 = I need to stick close

contents.culture: Eun-sung openly declaring his intention to stay close to Hye-in—a direct provocation.

contents.original: 참 든든하네요.
contents.pronunciation: Cham deundeun-haneyo.
contents.translation: How reassuring.
contents.culture: Hyun-woo's sarcastic response masking his jealousy.

contents.original: 아, 이거 갖다주는 거야? 응.
contents.pronunciation: A, igeo gatdajuneun geoya? Eung.
contents.translation: Oh, you're bringing this to her? Yeah.

grammar.example: 갖다주는 거야 = are you bringing this

contents.original: 갑자기 궁금해서 그러는데.
contents.pronunciation: Gapjagi gunggeumhaeseo geureuneunde.
contents.translation: I'm suddenly curious about something.

contents.original: 뭐가?
contents.pronunciation: Mwoga?
contents.translation: About what?

contents.original: 남이 머리 만지는 거 안 좋아하지 않아?
contents.pronunciation: Nam-i meori manjineun geo an joahaji ana?
contents.translation: Don't you dislike other people touching your hair?

grammar.example: 남이 머리 만지는 거 = others touching your hair

contents.original: 응? 아니, 왜? 저번에 내가 한번 만졌을 때 스타일 망가진다고 죽고 싶냐고 화냈었잖아.
contents.pronunciation: Eung? Ani, wae? Jeobeon-e naega hanbeon manjyeosseul ttae seutail mangga-jindago jukgo sipnyago hwanaesseotjana.
contents.translation: Huh? Why? Last time I touched it, you got mad saying your style was ruined and asked if I wanted to die.

grammar.example: 스타일 망가진다고 = saying the style would be ruined

grammar.explanation: Rhetorical threat 'do you want to die'
grammar.example: 죽고 싶냐고 화냈었잖아 = you got mad asking if I wanted to die

contents.culture: Common Korean expression of anger—'do you want to die?' is hyperbolic but commonly used.

contents.original: 뭔 소리야?
contents.pronunciation: Mwon soriya?
contents.translation: What are you talking about?

grammar.example: 뭔 소리야 = what are you talking about

contents.original: 알아둘게, 말해. 나한텐 그렇게 화내고 왜 윤 대표한테는 화 안 내?
contents.pronunciation: Aradulge, malhae. Nahanten geureoke hwanaego wae Yun daepyo-hante-neun hwa an nae?
contents.translation: Just tell me, I'll remember. You got so mad at me, so why don't you get mad at CEO Yoon?

grammar.example: 알아둘게 = I'll keep it in mind

contents.original: 뭐? 아, 그거...
contents.pronunciation: Mwo? A, geugeo...
contents.translation: What? Oh, that...

contents.original: 공평했으면 좋겠거든. 윤 대표 말고도 네 머리 건드리는 남자들한테는 다 화를 내야지. 미용실 원장님만 빼고.
contents.pronunciation: Gongpyeong-haesseumyeon joketgeodeun. Yun daepyo malgo-do ne meori gеondeurineun namja-deul-hante-neun da hwa-reul naeyaji. Miyongsil wonjang-nim-man ppaego.
contents.translation: I want it to be fair. You should get mad at all men who touch your hair, not just CEO Yoon. Except your salon director.

grammar.example: 공평했으면 좋겠거든 = I want it to be fair

contents.culture: Hyun-woo's jealous demand wrapped in humor—the 'salon director exception' adds comic relief.

contents.original: 환불을 왜 못 해줘? 우리 애기가 이거 바르고 피부가 이 모양이 됐는데 치료비를 못 물어줄 망정 환불을 못 해줘?
contents.pronunciation: Hwanbul-eul wae mot haejwo? Uri aegi-ga igeo bareugo pibu-ga i moyang-i dwaenneunde chiryobi-reul mot murеojul manjeong hwanbul-eul mot haejwo?
contents.translation: Why can't you give a refund? My baby used this and her skin ended up like this—you won't even pay for treatment, let alone a refund?

grammar.example: 환불을 못 해줘? = can't give a refund?
치료비를 못 물어줄 = can't pay for treatment
못 물어줄 망정 = let alone paying

contents.culture: A 진상 (difficult customer) scene—this type of aggressive customer behavior is a common issue in Korean retail.

contents.original: 고객님, 제품 구매하신 지 8개월이 넘었고 이미 제품을 거의 다 사용하신 상태라...
contents.pronunciation: Gogaeknim, jepum gumae-hasin ji pal-gaewor-i neomeotgo imi jepum-eul geoeui da sayong-hasin sangtae-ra...
contents.translation: Ma'am, it's been over 8 months since you purchased, and you've already used almost all of the product...

contents.original: 야, 너 말 잘했다. 내가 이걸 거의 다 사용했기 때문에 내 얼굴이 이렇게 됐다고.
contents.pronunciation: Ya, neo mal jalhaetda. Naega igeol geoeui da sayong-haetgi ttaemun-e nae eolgul-i ireoke dwaetdago.
contents.translation: Hey, you said it right. My face became like this BECAUSE I used almost all of it.

grammar.example: 사용했기 때문에 = because I used it

contents.original: 내가 이걸 안 썼으면 내가 이렇게 안 됐겠지. 애기야, 너무 흥분하지 마. 또 올라와.
contents.pronunciation: Naega igeol an sseosseumyeon naega ireoke an dwaetgetji. Aegiya, neomu heungbun-haji ma. Tto ollawa.
contents.translation: If I hadn't used this, I wouldn't have ended up like this. Baby, don't get too excited. It'll flare up again.

grammar.example: 또 올라와 = it'll flare up again

contents.original: 됐고, 당장 환불해줘.
contents.pronunciation: Dwaetgo, dangjang hwanbul-haejwo.
contents.translation: Whatever, give me a refund right now.

grammar.example: 당장 환불해줘 = refund me right now

contents.original: 고객님, 그건 곤란합니다.
contents.pronunciation: Gogaeknim, geugeon gollan-hamnida.
contents.translation: Ma'am, that's difficult to do.

contents.original: 아, 이게 왜 이렇게 말귀를 못 알아쳐먹어?
contents.pronunciation: A, ige wae ireoke malgwi-reul mot aracheomeogeo?
contents.translation: Why can't you understand what I'm saying?

contents.original: 고객님, 진정하시고요.
contents.pronunciation: Gogaeknim, jinjeong-hasigoyo.
contents.translation: Ma'am, please calm down.

contents.original: 뭘 진정해? 어? 너가 나 지금 진상 취급하는 거지? 내가 진짜 진상이 뭔지 보여줘?
contents.pronunciation: Mwol jinjeong-hae? Eo? Neoga na jigeum jinsang chwi-geup-haneun geoji? Naega jinjja jinsang-i mwonji boyeojwo?
contents.translation: Calm down what? Are you treating me like a difficult customer? Want me to show you what a real difficult customer looks like?

grammar.example: 진상 취급하는 거지 = treating me like a difficult customer

contents.culture: 진상 (jinsang) is slang for an unreasonable, difficult customer who causes trouble in stores.

contents.original: 저... 야. 조심히 좀. 고객님, 여기서 이러시면 안 되고요.
contents.pronunciation: Jeo... ya. Josimhi jom. Gogaeknim, yeogi-seo ireosimyeon an doegoyo.
contents.translation: Um... hey. Be careful. Ma'am, you can't do this here.

grammar.example: 여기서 이러시면 안 되고요 = you can't do this here

contents.original: 야, 나 니들 같은 찌그레기들이랑 얘기할 생각 없고 사장 나오라고 그래. 당장 사장이 나오라고 그래!
contents.pronunciation: Ya, na nideul gateun jjigeulegi-deul-irang yaegi-hal saenggak eopgo sajang naorago geurae. Dangjang sajang-i naorago geurae!
contents.translation: Hey, I'm not gonna talk to trash like you—get the boss out here. Tell the boss to come out right now!

contents.original: 나왔네요. 뭐? 제가 사장이에요.
contents.pronunciation: Nawanne-yo. Mwo? Jega sajang-ieyo.
contents.translation: Here she is. What? I'm the boss.

contents.original: 당신이 사장이야? 근데 직원 교육이 왜 이따위야?
contents.pronunciation: Dangsin-i sajang-iya? Geunde jigwon gyoyuk-i wae ittawi-ya?
contents.translation: You're the boss? Then why is your staff training so terrible?

grammar.example: 왜 이따위야 = why is it this terrible

contents.original: 그러게요. 저희 직원 교육이 좀 미흡했네요. 김민지 씨?
contents.pronunciation: Geureoge-yo. Jeohui jigwon gyoyuk-i jom mihup-haenne-yo. Kim Minji ssi?
contents.translation: You're right. Our staff training was lacking. Ms. Kim Minji?

contents.original: 응대는 고객한테만 하세요. 폭력 쓰는 범죄자는 경고 생략하고 신고하면 됩니다.
contents.pronunciation: Eungdae-neun gogaek-hante-man haseyo. Pongnyeok sseuneun beomjoeja-neun gyeongo saengnyak-hago singo-hamyeon doemnida.
contents.translation: Only provide service to customers. For violent criminals, skip the warning and just report them.

grammar.example: 응대는 고객한테만 = service only to customers

contents.culture: Hye-in's fierce leadership style—protecting her employees from abusive customers.

contents.original: 뭐, 뭐 범죄자... 와, 이제 아주 고객을 범죄자라고요? 아주 고객을 범죄자 취급까지...
contents.pronunciation: Mwo, mwo beomjoeja... Wa, ije aju gogaek-eul beomjoeja-rago-yo? Aju gogaek-eul beomjoeja chwi-geup-kkaji...
contents.translation: Wh-what, criminal... Wow, you're calling a customer a criminal now? Treating a customer like a criminal...

grammar.example: 범죄자 취급 = treating like a criminal

contents.original: 아, 애기야, 이거 다 찍고 있지? 어, 오빠. 아니, 백화점 사장 갑질 장난 아니네. 혼 좀 줘야겠어. 우리 고소해, 오빠. 그러자.
contents.pronunciation: A, aegiya, igeo da jjikgo itji? Eo, oppa. Ani, baekhwajeom sajang gapjil jangnan anine. Hon jom jwoyagetsseo. Uri goso-hae, oppa. Geureoja.
contents.translation: Baby, you're recording all this, right? Yeah, oppa. The department store boss's abuse of power is no joke. We need to teach her a lesson. Let's sue, oppa. Let's do it.

grammar.explanation: Slang for 'power abuse/bullying by someone in power'

grammar.example: 혼 좀 줘야겠어 = I need to teach her a lesson

contents.culture: 갑질 (gapjil) is a major social issue in Korea—power abuse by those in higher positions.

contents.original: 꼭 하세요. 저도 할 거예요. 제 남편이 좀 유능한 변호사라 잘 아는데 이런 경우가 아마 업무 방해, 특수 폭행죄, 재물 손괴죄에 해당할 겁니다.
contents.pronunciation: Kkok haseyo. Jeodo hal geoyeyo. Je nampyeon-i jom yuneung-han byeonhosa-ra jal aneunde ireon gyeong-u-ga ama eommu bangae, teuksu pokhaeng-joe, jaemul son-goe-joe-e haedang-hal geomnida.
contents.translation: Please do. I will too. My husband is a capable lawyer, so I know—this case probably falls under obstruction of business, aggravated assault, and property damage.
contents.culture: Hye-in using legal knowledge to counter-threaten—her husband being a lawyer comes in handy.

contents.original: 영업이 중지되면서 일어난 손해에 대한 배상 청구는 따로 진행할 거고요. 다들 찍으셨죠?
contents.pronunciation: Yeongeop-i jungji-doemyeonseo ireonan sonhae-e daehan baesang cheonggu-neun ttaro jinhaeng-hal geogoyo. Dadeul jjigeusyeotjyo?
contents.translation: We'll separately pursue damages for business losses from the disruption. Did everyone record this?

grammar.example: 배상 청구는 따로 = damage claims separately

contents.original: 네, 찍었어요. 여기, 여기. 여기, 여기. 경찰서로 연계해주세요.
contents.pronunciation: Ne, jjigeosseoyo. Yeogi, yeogi. Yeogi, yeogi. Gyeongchalseо-ro yeon-gye-haejuseyo.
contents.translation: Yes, we recorded it. Here, here. Here, here. Please report to the police.

grammar.example: 경찰서로 연계해주세요 = report to the police

contents.original: 그냥 애기야, 가자. 빨리, 빨리. 빨리, 빨리.
contents.pronunciation: Geunyang aegiya, gaja. Ppalli, ppalli. Ppalli, ppalli.
contents.translation: Baby, let's just go. Hurry, hurry. Quick, quick.
contents.culture: The troublemakers flee when they realize they're outmatched legally.

contents.original: 지난 생신 때 찾아뵙지도 못하고 해서 동네 친구분들 식사라도 대접할까 해서 왔어요.
contents.pronunciation: Jinan saengsin ttae chajabwepji-do motago haeseo dongne chingubunn-deul siksa-rado daejеop-halkka haeseo wasseoyo.
contents.translation: I couldn't visit for your last birthday, so I came to treat your neighborhood friends to a meal.

grammar.example: 지난 생신 때 = on your last birthday
식사라도 대접할까 해서 = thinking of treating to a meal

contents.culture: Hye-in shows unexpected humility by visiting her in-laws' rural village and treating the locals.

contents.original: 안녕하세요, 저는 백현우 이장님 며느리 홍혜인입니다.
contents.pronunciation: Annyeong-haseyo, jeoneun Baek Hyeonwu ijang-nim myeoneuri Hong Hyein-imnida.
contents.translation: Hello, I'm Hong Hye-in, daughter-in-law of Village Chief Baek Hyun-woo's father.
contents.culture: Hye-in introducing herself as 'daughter-in-law' rather than 'Queens Group heiress' shows humility and respect for rural customs.

contents.original: 어떻게 된 거야? 내가 톡을 했거든. 올 개가 언제 한 번 오겠다고 했잖아.
contents.pronunciation: Eotteoke doen geoya? Naega tok-eul haetgeodeun. Ol gae-ga eonje hanbeon ogetdago haetjana.
contents.translation: How did this happen? I texted her. She said she'd come sometime.

grammar.explanation: Expression meaning 'to send a KakaoTalk message'
grammar.example: 톡을 했거든 = I sent a message

contents.culture: '톡' refers to KakaoTalk, Korea's dominant messaging app.

contents.original: 그 언제 한 번이 오늘 바로 Right Now일 수 있을까?
contents.pronunciation: Geu eonje hanbeon-i oneul baro Right Now-il su isseulkka?
contents.translation: That 'sometime' could be today, right now?

contents.original: 지금 아버지 이장 타이틀 방어전에 잠시 적신호가 켜져서 말이야. 이를테면 지지 유세 같은 게 좀 필요하거든.
contents.pronunciation: Jigeum abeoji ijang taitеul bang-eojeоn-e jamsi jeoksinho-ga kyeojyeoseo mariya. Irеultеmyeon jiji yuse gateun ge jom pilyo-hagеodeun.
contents.translation: Father's village chief title defense is in trouble right now. We need something like a support campaign.

grammar.example: 적신호가 켜져서 = a red light came on
지지 유세 같은 게 = something like a support campaign

contents.culture: Even village chief positions in Korea can involve political campaigning among locals.

contents.original: 그 톡을 받고 왔다고? 나도 신기해, 지금.
contents.pronunciation: Geu tok-eul batgo watdago? Na-do singihae, jigeum.
contents.translation: She came because of that text? I'm amazed too, right now.

contents.original: 별 건 아니고요. 고가의 영양제와 인삼과 홍삼 등 건강식품, 화장품과 실크스카프, 캐시미어 머플러와 이태리산 가죽장갑 등등인데 아버님 드리려고 조금만 산다는 게 좀 양조절이 안 됐네요.
contents.pronunciation: Byeol geon anigoyo. Goga-ui yeongyang-je-wa insam-gwa hongsam deung geongang-sikpum, hwajangpum-gwa silkeu-seukapeuu, kaesi-mieo meopeulleo-wa Itaellisan gajuk-janggap deungdeung-inde abeonim deurirуеogo jogeum-man sandaneun ge jom yang-jojeol-i an dwaenne-yo.
contents.translation: It's nothing much. Expensive supplements, ginseng and red ginseng health products, cosmetics, silk scarves, cashmere mufflers, Italian leather gloves, etc. I meant to buy just a little for Father, but I couldn't control the quantity.

grammar.example: 양조절이 안 됐네요 = couldn't control the quantity

contents.culture: Hye-in's chaebol-style gift-giving—overwhelming the rural villagers with luxury items to win their favor for her father-in-law's election.

contents.original: 친한 분들과 나누세요. 아이, 너도 참. 양조절을 잘하지.
contents.pronunciation: Chinhan bun-deul-gwa naneuseyo. Ai, neo-do cham. Yang-jojeol-eul jalhaji.
contents.translation: Share with your close friends. Geez, you too. Control yourself better.

grammar.example: 친한 분들과 나누세요 = share with close friends

contents.culture: The father-in-law is pleased but pretends to scold her for overdoing it.
